body_html:
@everybody, along the lines of suggestions by @reedwm ,the following steps seems to have solved the issue :

  1. Install anaconda for python
  2. Compile tensorflow from the source

A few errors crop up during training as @daemon mentioned above due to incompatibility of train.py with Python 3. It has to do with the usage of map and xrange in particular.(while calculating len, len(list( )) has to be used and xrange has to be replaced with range)

Thank you @reedwm for your help earlier.
body_text:
@everybody, along the lines of suggestions by @reedwm ,the following steps seems to have solved the issue :

Install anaconda for python
Compile tensorflow from the source

A few errors crop up during training as @daemon mentioned above due to incompatibility of train.py with Python 3. It has to do with the usage of map and xrange in particular.(while calculating len, len(list( )) has to be used and xrange has to be replaced with range)
Thank you @reedwm for your help earlier.
body:
@everybody, along the lines of suggestions by @reedwm ,the following steps seems to have solved the issue : 
  1. Install anaconda for python
  2. Compile tensorflow from the source 

A few errors crop up during training as @daemon mentioned above due to incompatibility of train.py with Python 3. It has to do with the usage of map and xrange in particular.(while calculating len, len(list( )) has to be used and xrange has to be replaced with range)  

Thank you @reedwm for your help earlier.
